Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Intrathecal Morphine Doses in Total Knee Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomized into three groups

Participants.evidence: This retrospective, single-center study at the University of Alabama at Birmingham included 75 patients undergoing primary TKA

Intervention.evidence: a control group receiving continuous adductor canal block (CCACB) and two experimental groups receiving single-dose adductor canal block (SSACB) with either 100 mcg or 150 mcg of ITM

Objective.evidence: This study compares two ITM doses to determine optimal analgesic efficacy and side effect profile

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was oral morphine equivalents (OME) consumption within 24 hours post-surgery

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was conducted using a random numbers generator

Result_Outcome.evidence: Both ITM groups showed significantly lower OME consumption and pain scores in the post-anesthesia care unit (PACU) compared to the control group (p<0.001)

Harms.evidence: No adverse events, including respiratory depression, were reported
